message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The absence of cardiac activity in the embryo suggests a missed abortion. Misoprostol is a medication used to help complete a miscarriage.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a gestational sac and embryo with absent cardiac activity indicates an embryonic demise. Misoprostol therapy is the most appropriate next step for medical management of a missed miscarriage. Cervical cerclage is used in cases of cervical incompetence, thrombophilia work-up is not indicated in this scenario, and methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of an embryo in the gestational sac but with absent cardiac activity suggests a missed abortion or silent miscarriage. Misoprostol therapy is the most appropriate next step in management to help with the expulsion of the pregnancy tissue. Cervical cerclage is not indicated in this case, as the patient is not at risk for cervical incompetence. Thrombophilia work-up is not indicated, as there is no indication of a clotting disorder. Methotrexate therapy is not indicated, as this is used for ectopic pregnancies, not missed abortions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The absence of cardiac activity suggests a missed abortion, and misoprostol therapy is the initial management for a missed abortion. Cervical cerclage is used for cervical incompetence, thrombophilia work-up is not relevant in this case, and methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The absence of cardiac activity on ultrasound suggests a missed abortion. Misoprostol therapy is the appropriate next step in management to induce uterine contractions and bring about complete abortion. Cervical cerclage is not indicated in this situation. Thrombophilia work-up is not necessary. Methotrexate is used to treat ectopic pregnancy but not missed abortion.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The absence of cardiac activity indicates a nonviable pregnancy, which is confirmed by transvaginal ultrasonography. Misoprostol therapy is the appropriate next step to induce medical abortion. Cervical cerclage is used for cervical incompetence, thrombophilia work-up is not necessary at this point, and Methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a missed abortion confirmed by transvaginal ultrasound, which shows an embryo with absent cardiac activity. Misoprostol is the most appropriate next step for management, as it will help in the expulsion of the products of conception. Cervical cerclage is used to prevent premature birth and is not indicated in this case. Thrombophilia work-up and methotrexate therapy are not indicated.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a gestational sac and embryo but with no cardiac activity suggests a missed miscarriage. Misoprostol therapy is the most appropriate next step in management. Cervical cerclage is used for cervical incompetence, thrombophilia work-up is not indicated at this stage, and methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The absence of cardiac activity in the embryo suggests a missed miscarriage. Misoprostol therapy is a commonly used method to manage a missed miscarriage. Cervical cerclage is not indicated in this case, as there is no cervical incompetence or risk of preterm labor. Thrombophilia work-up is not indicated in this case, as it is not a causative factor for missed miscarriage. Methotrexate therapy is used in ectopic pregnancies, not in missed miscarriages.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The absence of cardiac activity suggests embryonic demise, which requires management. Misoprostol therapy is the most appropriate next step in management to induce expulsion of the uterine contents. Cervical cerclage is not indicated in this case. Thrombophilia work-up is not necessary in this situation. Methotrexate therapy is not indicated in this case as it is used for medical management of ectopic pregnancy.
